messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:23): GPHemsley: you gave me a heads-up a while back that some of the circled-i links from http://dev.w3.org/html5/markup/ back to the HTML5 spec were broken
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:24): fwiw, I've fixed them all now
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:35): i saw a tweet from @html5 about spec links for forms attributes but it looks like the link is broken
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:35): or i'm missing something
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:37): 92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d: http://twitter.com/html5/status/19280941985 ?
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:38): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yep, i got "sorry not found"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:38): I guess the list archive might just be slow
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:39): I have had the same problem with other mail-archive links recently

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I see what you mean about HyBi being quiet until you post... alhough I suppose it could be a coincidence (since the volume was picking up a bit over the last few days)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:39): I will let the W3C systems team know
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:39): (but today has been absurd)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:42): 92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d: all of the twitter @html5 links go to here:
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:42): to individual messages here:
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:42): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-diffs/latest
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: ok, thanks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:44): 92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d: btw, do you know if there's been any discussion at Mozilla yet about implementing the HTML5 context-menu feature?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:44): http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/interactive-elements.html#context-menus I mean
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:45): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: not i've heard of
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:45): but i'm surely not the person to ask
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:45): i'm mostly working on forms
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:46): 92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d: is there a master page at the mozilla wiki that lists implementation status/plans for features-yet-unimplemented
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:46): i mean, like your forms-feature page
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:48): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: the best way to know that is bugzilla
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:48): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?query_format=advanced&short_desc=context-menu&short_desc_type=casesubstring&resolution=---&resolution=DUPLICATE

92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:49): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?query_format=advanced&short_desc=context-menu&bug_status=UNCONFIRMED&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&short_desc_type=casesubstring&resolution=---
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:49): ^ this one is better
92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d (23:49): so, i would say no one is working on it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:49): cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:49): thanks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:49): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:50): I do see this, though -
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: it's happened three or four times
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:50): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=578849
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:50): 92fd44f6f5704793df83313ba59be99d: Google Chrome team seems to also be working on a context-menu API
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:51): it makes me wonder if developers are browser projects are actually aware of the context-menu feature already in HTML5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:51): uri?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:52): realize that bug is for a jetpack feature
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: will look now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): i don't think that's web-facing
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: We have a context-menu API for Chrome Extensions.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): sure, but that's not web-facing either
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:52): is HTML5's built-in context menu support not good enough for Chrome Extensions?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:52): was going to say, about the Chrome thing, I think 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb is on top of it already
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:53): we are considering just using the HTML5 feature for Safari Extensions but if it's not going to be good enough we may as well invent our own thing too

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:53): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: from what I've seen of the Chrome Extensions context-menu API so far, it looks like it could be done using what's in the HTML5 spec instead
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:54): but maybe 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb has some feedback from the dev team about why it may not actually be
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:55): aboodman: <-- can tell you _everything_
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:56): is anxious to hear from aboodman

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:57): anyway, if what's in the HTML5 spec is not sufficient, it'd seem like a way to address that would be for implementors to provide some feedback to help make it sufficient
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:58): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:58): especially given the fact that we already know a lot of stuff that starts out not-web-facing eventually does become web-facing
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:58): e.g., stuff starting out only in XUL etc.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (00:01): reads "Please disallow "javascript:" URLs in browser address bars" message
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (00:03): btw, the W3C mailing-list-archive Archived-At: http://www.w3.org/mid/ thingy appears to be broken at the moment

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:11): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: (re: non-web-facing stuff migrating to web-facing) Indeed, especially since Chrome Extensions are only *barely* not web-facing - they're just web pages that are given access to a few specialized js apis.
